channel.title: HELP! Problem with my JCreator
channel.description: When I set up the JCreator for .java's file. Now, i found the new icon which is JCreator's icon on my .java's file. When I click on it, why its open as normal/old notepad? HELP! :(

item.title: HELP! Problem with my JCreator
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Open Windows Explorer
Tools>Folder Options
Go to the File Types tab
Scroll down to java, where you can change the file association as well as the icon if you’d like.

Note I assumed you’re using windows XP or older…if this doesn’t help, perhaps some more info would be useful

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! Problem with my JCreator
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Are you sure you’re opening the right file? I haven’t used JCreator in a while but I know that when you save something you’ll have quite a few different files. It’s possible that you’re trying to open the wrong one.

By the way, it’s not very easy to understand what you’re saying. Could you try to use better grammar? I’ll understand if English isn’t you’re first language or something though.

Read full topic
